turns.user_message: Also, hey, what was that specific iso setting you found best for your new mirrorless camera when you're doing low-light street shots with your fast prime lens, to keep the noise down?
turns.expected_response: You mentioned that for low-light street photography with your f/1.8 prime lens, you found ISO 6400 to be optimal for your new mirrorless camera to minimize noise. (From memory: 'Remember when we were talking about my new mirrorless camera? I finally figured out the optimal ISO setting for low-light street photography without too much noise – it's surprisingly high, around ISO 6400, but only when I use the f/1.8 prime lens.')

relevant_memories.content: Remember when we were talking about my new mirrorless camera? I finally figured out the optimal ISO setting for low-light street photography without too much noise – it's surprisingly high, around ISO 6400, but only when I use the f/1.8 prime lens.
I also mentioned I'm thinking of getting a new tripod. I saw a really lightweight carbon fiber one online that folds down super small, perfect for travel.
Oh, and I was trying to explain the difference between aperture and shutter speed to my cousin last week. It's tricky to get them to grasp how f-stops work.
Luna loves playing with her new squeaky ball. She's so energetic!
I need to buy some more puppy food for Luna soon. She eats a lot!
